gen:ReportedAttribute.com:Text: Objective 12. Establish sustainable consumption and production patterns
12.2 By 2030, achieve sustainable management and rational use of natural resources
12.2.1. Population growth rate
Burundi Institute of Statistics and Economic Studies (ISTEEBU)
NDAYISENGA Modest
Social studies and statistics and poverty monitoring (ESSSP)
ESSSP department manager
1156 BUJUMBURA
ndayimode2010@gmail.com
Difference between crude birth rate and crude death rate. It measures the increase of a population over a period of time due only to births and deaths
Percentage
census or population projections
Demographic projections
The probable date of the next collection will be 2021 (Next DHS)
ISTEEBU
ISTEEBU is responsible for compiling this indicator at the national level
ISTEEBU is the body recognized by the Burundian government for the collection, processing and dissemination of official statistics helping in planning and decision-making.

This indicator is relevant because it highlights the difference between the crude birth rate and the crude death rate. It measures the increase of a population over a period of time due only to births and deaths
Updating the indicator requires a household survey which is very resource intensive. The indicator cannot be calculated by gender.
It is the difference between the crude birth rate and the crude death rate. It measures the increase of a population over a period of time due only to births and deaths
The results of the survey are validated at two levels: technical validation and official validation before publication
The indicator is available at national level
The indicator can be compared to other indicators of the same type at regional and international level
ISTEEBU, Demographic projections report

ISTEEBU
ISTEEBU is responsible for compiling this indicator at the national level
ISTEEBU is the body recognized by the Burundian government for the collection, processing and dissemination of official statistics helping in planning and decision-making.

This indicator is relevant because it highlights the difference between the crude birth rate and the crude death rate. It measures the increase of a population over a period of time due only to births and deaths

Objective 12. Establish sustainable consumption and production patterns
12.2 By 2030, achieve sustainable management and rational use of natural resources
12.2.2. Total fertility rate
Burundi Institute of Statistics and Economic Studies (ISTEEBU)
NDAYISENGA Modest
Social studies and statistics and poverty monitoring (ESSSP)
ESSSP department manager
1156 BUJUMBURA
ndayimode2010@gmail.com;

The total fertility rate measures the number of children a woman would have, during her fertile life, if she behaved in accordance with the fertility-by-age observed in a given year. It is obtained by adding the average number of births per woman in all the years defined as fertile (from 15 to 49 years)
Number
Household surveys
Data are collected from household surveys using the "household" questionnaire
The probable date of the next collection will be 2021 (Next DHS)
ISTEEBU
ISTEEBU is responsible for compiling this indicator at the national level
ISTEEBU is the body recognized by the Burundian government for the collection, processing and dissemination of official statistics helping in planning and decision-making.

The total fertility rate is relevant because it measures the number of children a woman would have, during her fertile life, if she behaved in accordance with the fertility by age observed in a given year. It is obtained by adding the average number of births per woman in all the years defined as fertile (from 15 to 49 years)
Updating the indicator requires a household survey which is very resource intensive. The indicator cannot be calculated by gender.
It is obtained by adding the average number of births per woman in all the years defined as fertile (from 15 to 49 years)
The results of the survey are validated at two levels: technical validation and official validation before publication
The indicator is available at national level, province, area of residence (National; Urban area; Rural area)
The indicator can be compared to other indicators of the same type at regional and international level
EDSB Household Survey Report

Objective 12. Establish sustainable consumption and production patterns
12.6 Encourage businesses, especially large corporations and transnational corporations, to adopt sustainable practices and to include sustainability information in their reports
12.6.1 Number of companies publishing sustainability reports (Number of companies with environmental impact assessment certificates)
Ministry of the Environment, Agriculture and Livestock
MBAZUMUTIMANA Dieudonne
Statistical service
Focal point for the production of the Ministry's SDGs
dembaze@yahoo.fr
This is the number of companies with certificates of environmental impact studies
Number
Ministry of the Environment, Agriculture and Livestock
Administrative data
Annual
annual
MINEAGRIE
MINEAGRIE
The Ministerial departments are the members of the SSN whose mission is to collect, process and disseminate the data of their sector.
The indicator is relevant because it reflects the level of environmental protection
The completeness of this indicator depends on the regular collection of data from the field
Statement of companies with environmental impact study certificates
annual
The indicator is available at national level
The indicator can be compared to other indicators of the same type at regional and international level
Annual Report

Objective 12. Establish sustainable consumption and production patterns

12.4 By 2020, achieve environmentally sound management of chemicals and all wastes throughout their life cycle, in accordance with internationally agreed guidelines, and significantly reduce their release to air , water and soil, in order to minimize their negative effects on health and the environment
12.4.2. Percentage of identified treatment sites are operational before 2018 and the maximum before 2025
Ministry of Transport, Public Works, Equipment and Land Use Planning (MTTPEAT)
Mr KIGABO Marijani SAIDI
Statistical service
Focal point for the production of the Ministry's SDGs
marisaidi212@gmail.com
This is the percentage of functional waste treatment sites compared to all existing waste treatment sites
Percentage
The indicator comes from administrative data
Ratio of functional waste treatment sites to all existing waste treatment sites
annual
Annual
SETEMU
MTTPEAT Statistical Service
SETEMU is the body recognized by the Burundian government as municipal technical services
This indicator is relevant because it highlights the percentage of functional waste treatment sites compared to all existing waste treatment sites.
The update is annual
Ratio of functional waste treatment sites to all existing waste treatment sites
Annual
The indicator is available at national level
The indicator can be compared to other indicators of the same type at regional and international level
MTTPEAT Annual Report

Objective 12. Establish sustainable consumption and production patterns

12.4 By 2020, achieve environmentally sound management of chemicals and all wastes throughout their life cycle, in accordance with internationally agreed guidelines, and significantly reduce their release to air , water and soil, in order to minimize their negative effects on health and the environment
12.4.2. Percentage of identified treatment sites are operational before 2018 and the maximum before 2025
Ministry of Transport, Public Works, Equipment and Land Use Planning (MTTPEAT)
Mr KIGABO Marijani SAIDI
Statistical service
Focal point for the production of the Ministry's SDGs
marisaidi212@gmail.com
This is the percentage of functional waste treatment sites compared to all existing waste treatment sites
Percentage
The indicator comes from administrative data
Ratio of functional waste treatment sites to all existing waste treatment sites
annual
Annual
SETEMU
MTTPEAT Statistical Service
SETEMU is the body recognized by the Burundian government as municipal technical services
This indicator is relevant because it highlights the percentage of functional waste treatment sites compared to all existing waste treatment sites.
The update is annual
Ratio of functional waste treatment sites to all existing waste treatment sites
Annual
The indicator is available at national level
The indicator can be compared to other indicators of the same type at regional and international level

Objective 12. Establish sustainable consumption and production patterns
12.a Help developing countries acquire the scientific and technological means that will enable them to move towards more sustainable consumption and production patterns
12.a.1 Amount of assistance provided to developing countries for research and development activities on sustainable consumption and production patterns and environmentally sound technologies
category III

Determination of the amount of assistance provided to developing countries for research and development activities devoted to sustainable consumption and production patterns and environmentally sound technologies
Not available
The indicator can be compared to other indicators of the same type at regional and international level
Objective 12. Establish sustainable consumption and production patterns

12.c Rationalize wasteful fossil fuel subsidies, through the elimination of market distortions, taking into account the national context, including through tax restructuring and phasing out harmful subsidies that are in place, demonstrating their impact on the environment, taking full account of the specific needs and circumstances of developing countries and minimizing any negative effects on the development of these countries while protecting the poor and the populations concerned
12.c.1 Amount of fossil fuel subsidies per unit of GDP (production and consumption) and as a proportion of total national spending on these fuels
category III
Category III

Objective 12. Establish sustainable consumption and production patterns
12.b Develop and use tools to monitor the impact on sustainable development of sustainable tourism that creates jobs and promotes local culture and products
